SBML Model Representation¶

SBML Layout¶

Creates a Python interface to load, display and manipulate models defined in an SBML file, making use of a c API and libsbml.

class libsbml_draw.model.sbml_layout.BezierPoints(start, end, control1, control2)¶
property control1¶

Alias for field number 2

property control2¶

Alias for field number 3

property end¶

Alias for field number 1

property start¶

Alias for field number 0

class libsbml_draw.model.sbml_layout.SBMLlayout(sbml_source=None, layout_alg_options=None, layout_number=0, fitToWindow=(), autoComputeLayout=False, applyRender=True)¶

SBMLlayout represents the model in an SBML file.

LIBSBML_DRAW_VERSION = '1.0.0'¶
NODE_KEYWORDS = {'all', 'boundary', 'floating'}¶
WIDTH_PADDING = 2¶
HEIGHT_PADDING = 1¶
loadSBMLFile(sbml_file)¶

Loads the SBML model into SBMLlayout.

Args:

sbml_string(str): name of file containing an SBML model

Returns: None

loadSBMLString(sbml_string)¶

Loads the SBML model into SBMLlayout.

Args:

sbml_string(str): SBML model in string format

Returns: None

setLayoutAlgorithmOptions(k=None, gravity=None, baryx=None, baryy=None, autobary=None, padding=None)¶

Set values for the Fruchterman-Reingold layout algorithm parameters.

Args:

k (float): gravity (float): baryx (float): baryy (float): autobary (int): padding (float):

Returns: None

setLayoutAlgorithm_k(k)¶

Set the Fruchterman-Reingold layout algorithm parameter ‘k’.

Args:

k (float): stiffness parameter

Returns: None

setLayoutAlgorithm_gravity(gravity)¶

Set the Fruchterman-Reingold layout algorithm parameter ‘gravity’.

Args:
gravity (float): strength of the gravity, must be greater than 5 to

have an effect.

Returns: None

setLayoutAlgorithm_baryx(baryx)¶

Set the Fruchterman-Reingold layout algorithm parameter ‘baryx’.

Args:

baryx (float): x value of the center of gravitational force

Returns: None

setLayoutAlgorithm_baryy(baryy)¶

Set the Fruchterman-Reingold layout algorithm parameter ‘baryy’.

Args:

baryy (float): y value of the center of gravitational force

Returns: None

setLayoutAlgorithm_autobary(autobary)¶

Set the Fruchterman-Reingold layout algorithm parameter ‘autobary’. This parameter determines if the barycenter is set automatically from layout info.

Args:
autobary (int): 1 = set barycenter automatically from layout info,

0 means don’t set it automatically

Returns: None

setLayoutAlgorithm_padding(padding)¶

Set the Fruchterman-Reingold layout algorithm parameter ‘padding’.

Args:

padding (float): padding on compartments

Returns: None

getLayoutAlgorithmOptions()¶

Get the Fruchterman-Reingold layout algorithm parameter values.

Args: None

Returns: instance of the fr_alg_options class

showLayoutAlgorithmOptions()¶

Prints out the values of the Fruchterman-Reingold algorithm paramters, which are: k, grav, baryx, baryy, autobary, and padding.

Args: None

Returns: None

regenerateLayoutAndResetRenderInfo()¶

Use this to generate a new layout, and reset the network’s node and reaction layout and render values.

Args: None

Returns: None

regenerateLayout()¶

Use this to generate a new layout, and update the network’s node reaction, and compartment layout values.

Args: None

Returns: None

describeModel()¶

Provides a summary of the model built from the SBML file.

Args: None Returns: None

getNumberOfCompartments()¶

Returns the number of compartments in the model.

Args: None Returns: None

getNumberOfNodes()¶

Returns the number of nodes in the model.

Args: None Returns: None

getNumberOfReactions()¶

Returns the number of reactions in the model.

Args: None Returns: None

Specify the Model level and version.

Args:

level (int): model level version (int): model version

Returns: None

aliasNode(node_id)¶

Creates an alias of this node for each incoming and outgoing reaction.

Args:

node_id (str):

Returns: None

getIsNodeAliased(node_id)¶

Returns True if this node is an alias of earlier node.

Args:

node_id (str):

Returns: None

getIsNodeLocked(node_id)¶

Returns True if this node is locked.

Args:

node_id(str): id for the node

Returns: bool

lockNode(node_id)¶

Locks the node so that a new layout can be generated w/o moving this node.

Args:

node_id (str): id for the node

Returns: None

unlockNode(node_id)¶

Unlocks a previously locked node.

Args:

node_id (str): id for the node

Returns: None

setNetworkBackgroundColor(bg_color)¶

Sets the background color of the network.

Args:

bg_color (str): id of the color for the background

Returns: None

getNetworkBackgroundColor()¶

Returns the color id for the background color of the network.

Args: None

Returns: str

getNodeCentroid(node_id)¶

Returns the center point of the node.

Args:

node_id (str): id for the node

Returns: tuple, with x and y

getReactionCentroid(reaction_id)¶

Returns the centroid of the reaction.

Args:

reaction_id (str): id of the reaction

Returns: tuple, with x and y

Writes the model as an SBML file.

Args:

out_file_name (str): name of the file to write

Returns: None

getCompartmentIds()¶

Returns a list of compartment ids.

Args: None

Returns: list of str

setCompartmentEdgeColor(compartment_id, edge_color)¶

Sets the compartment edge color.

Args:
compartment_id (str): id of the compartment to change the color of

one compartment, or ‘all’ to change the color of all the compartments

edge_color (str): id of the color

Returns: None

getCompartmentEdgeColor(compartment_id)¶

Returns the color id for the compartment edge color.

Args:

compartment_id(str): id for the compartment

Returns: str

setCompartmentFillColor(compartment_id, fill_color)¶

Sets the compartment fill color.

Args:
compartment_id (str): id of the compartment to change the color of

one compartment, or ‘all’ to change the color of all the compartments

fill_color (str): id of the color

Returns: None

getCompartmentFillColor(compartment_id)¶

Returns the color id for the compartment fill color.

Args:

compartment_id(str): id for the compartment

Returns: str

getCompartmentLineWidth(compartment_id)¶

Returns the line width for the given compartment.

Args: compartment_id (str): id for the compartment

Returns: int

setCompartmentLineWidth(compartment_id, line_width)¶

Sets the line width of the compartment.

Args:
compartment_id (str): id of the compartment to change the width of

one compartment, or ‘all’ to change the width of all the compartments

line_width (int): numeric value representing the line width

Returns: None

Args:

node_id (str): id for the node

Returns: str

getNodeKeywordIds(node_keyword)¶

Returns a list of node ids corresponding to the given keyword.

Args:

node_keyword(str): ‘all’, ‘boundary’, or ‘floating’

Returns: list of str

setNodeColor(node_id, node_color)¶

Sets the node edge color and fill color to the same value.

Args:
node_id (str or list of str): id of the node to change,

or keyword ‘all’, ‘boundary’, or ‘floating’ to change the color of all the nodes of that type, or a list of node ids to change.

node_color (str): id of the color

Returns: None

getNodeFillColor(node_id)¶

Returns the color id for the node fill color.

Args: node_id(str): id of the node

Returns: str

setNodeFillColor(node_id, fill_color)¶

Sets the node fill color.

Args:
node_id (str or list of str): id of the node to change,

or keyword ‘all’, ‘boundary’, or ‘floating’ to change the color of all the nodes of that type, or a list of node ids to change.

fill_color (str): id of the color

Returns: None

getNodeEdgeColor(node_id)¶

Returns the color id for the node edge color.

Args:

node_id(str): id for the node

Returns: str

setNodeEdgeColor(node_id, edge_color)¶

Sets the node edge color.

Args:
node_id (str or list of str): id of the node to change,

or keyword ‘all’, ‘boundary’, or ‘floating’ to change the color of all the nodes of that type, or a list of node ids to change.

edge_color (str): id of the color

Returns: None

getNodeEdgeWidth(node_id)¶

Returns the line width for the node edge.

Args:

node_id(str): id for the node

Returns: float

setNodeEdgeWidth(node_id, edge_width)¶

Sets the line width of the node edge.

Args:
node_id (str or list of str): id of the node to change,

or keyword ‘all’, ‘boundary’, or ‘floating’ to change the color of all the nodes of that type, or a list of node ids to change.

edge_width (float): line width of the edge

Returns: None

getNodeTextAnchor(node_id)¶

Returns the horizontal text anchor for the node.

Args:

node_id(str): id for the node

Returns: str

setNodeTextAnchor(node_id, text_anchor)¶

Sets the horizontal text anchor for the node.

Args:
node_id (str or list of str): id of the node to change,

or keyword ‘all’, ‘boundary’, or ‘floating’ to change the color of all the nodes of that type, or a list of node ids to change.

text_anchor (str): “center”, “left”, “right”

Returns: None

getNodeVTextAnchor(node_id)¶

Returns the vertical text anchor for the node.

Args:

node_id(str): id for the node

Returns: str

setNodeVTextAnchor(node_id, vtext_anchor)¶

Sets the vertical text anchor for the node.

Args:
node_id (str or list of str): id of the node to change,

or keyword ‘all’, ‘boundary’, or ‘floating’ to change the color of all the nodes of that type, or a list of node ids to change.

vtext_anchor (str): “center”, “bottom”, “top”

Returns: None

getNodeFontSize(node_id)¶

Returns the font size of the node text.

Args:

node_id (str): id for the node

Returns: int

setNodeFontSize(node_id, font_size)¶

Set the font size for the node.

Args:
node_id (str): id of the node to change,

or keyword ‘all’, ‘boundary’, or ‘floating’ to change the color of all the nodes of that type, or a list of node ids to change.

font_size (int or str): matplotlib acceptable values, which are:

{size in points, ‘xx-small’, ‘x-small’, ‘small’, ‘medium’, ‘large’, ‘x-large’, ‘xx-large’}

Returns: None

getNodeFontName(node_id)¶

Returns the font family value, which can be the font family or font name.

Args:

node_id (str): id for the node

Returns: str, eg. “Arial” or “serif”

setNodeFontName(node_id, font_name)¶

Sets the font family for the node, which can be a value for the family or name of the font.

Args:
node_id (str): id of the node to change,

or keyword ‘all’, ‘boundary’, or ‘floating’ to change the color of all the nodes of that type, or a list of node ids to change.

font_name (str): value for font family (eg. ‘serif’) or font name (eg. ‘Arial’)

Returns: None

getNodeFontFamily(node_id)¶

Returns the font family value, which can be the font family or font name.

setNodeFontFamily(node_id, font_family)¶

Sets the font family for the node, which can be a value for either the family or name of the font.

Args:
node_id (str): id of the node to change,

or keyword ‘all’, ‘boundary’, or ‘floating’ to change the color of all the nodes of that type, or a list of node ids to change.

font_family (str): value for font family (eg. ‘serif’) or font name (eg. ‘Arial’)

Returns: None

getNodeFontColor(node_id)¶

Returns the color of the node’s text.

Args:

node_id (str): id for the node

Returns: str

setNodeFontColor(node_id, font_color)¶

Sets the node font color.

Args:
node_id (str or list of str): id of the node to change,

or keyword ‘all’, ‘boundary’, or ‘floating’ to change the color of all the nodes of that type, or a list of node ids to change.

font_color (str): id of the color

Returns: None

getNodeFontStyle(node_id)¶

Returns the style of the font for the given node.

Args:

node_id (str): id for the node

Returns: str, “italic”, “normal”, or “oblique”

setNodeFontStyle(node_id, font_style)¶

Sets the node font style.

Args:
node_id (str or list of str): id of the node to change,

or keyword ‘all’, ‘boundary’, or ‘floating’ to change the color of all the nodes of that type, or a list of node ids to change.

font_style (str): Available font styles are normal, italic, and

oblique.

Returns: None

getNodeFontWeight(node_id)¶

Returns the weight of the font for the given node.

Args:

node_id (str): id for the node

Returns: str, “bold” or “normal”

setNodeFontWeight(node_id, font_weight)¶

Sets the node font weight.

Args:
node_id (str or list of str): id of the node to change,

or keyword ‘all’, ‘boundary’, or ‘floating’ to change the color of all the nodes of that type, or a list of node ids to change.

font_weight (str): Available font weights are normal or bold.

Returns: None

Args:

node_id (str): id for the node

Returns: float

getNodeHeight(node_id)¶

Returns the height of the node.

Args:

node_id (str): id for the node

Returns: float

getNodeName(node_id)¶

Returns the name of the node.

Args:

node_id (str): id for the node

Returns: str

getNodeLowerLeftPoint(node_id)¶

Returns the point for the node’s lower left corner.

Args:

node_id (str): id for the node

Returns: point which has fields x and y

getBoundarySpeciesIds()¶

Gets the id values of the Species who have boundaryCondition set to True.

Args:

None

Returns: list of Species ids

getFloatingSpeciesIds()¶

Gets the id values of the Species who have boundaryCondition set to False.

Args:

None

Returns: list of Species ids

getReactionIds()¶

Gets the ids of the reactions in the model.

Args: None

Returns: list of Reaction ids

setReactionColor(reaction_id, reaction_color, role_name=None, species=None)¶

Sets the reaction edge color and fill color to the same value. If the role or species args are set, then the color is set only for curves in a reaction which have that role or are connected to that species.

Args:
reaction_id (str): id of the reaction to change the color of one

reaction, or ‘all’ to change the color of all the reactions

reaction_color (str): id of the color role_name (optional, str): role of the curve in the reaction,

for example, “product”

species (optional, str): species to which the curve is connected,

for example, “A” or “Node0”

Returns: None

getReactionEdgeColor(reaction_id)¶

Returns the color id for the edge color of the reaction.

Args:

reaction_id (str): id for the reaction

Returns: list of tuples of (curve species, curve role name, and curve

color) for each curve in the reaction

setReactionEdgeColor(reaction_id, edge_color, role_name=None, species=None)¶

Sets the reaction edge color for all curves in the reaction. If the role or species args are set, then the color is set only for curves in a reaction which have that role or are connected to that species.

Args:
reaction_id (str): id of the reaction to change the color of one

reaction, or ‘all’ to change the color of all the reactions

edge_color (str): id of the color role_name (optional, str): role of the curve in the reaction,

for example, “product”

species (optional, str): species to which the curve is connected,

for example, “A” or “Node0”

Returns: None

getReactionFillColor(reaction_id)¶

Returns the color id for the fill color of the reaction.

Args:

reaction_id (str): id for the reaction

Returns: list of tuples of (curve species, curve role name, and curve

color) for each curve in the reaction

setReactionFillColor(reaction_id, fill_color, role_name=None, species=None)¶

Sets the reaction fill color for all curves in the reaction. If the role or species args are set, then the color is set only for curves in a reaction which have that role or are connected to that species.

Args:
reaction_id (str): id of the reaction to change the color of one

reaction, or ‘all’ to change the color of all the reactions

fill_color (str): id of the color role_name (optional, str): role of the curve in the reaction,

for example, “product”

species (optional, str): species to which the curve is connected,

for example, “A” or “Node0”

Returns: None

getReactionCurveWidth(reaction_id)¶

Returns the curve width for all curves of the reaction.

Args:

reaction_id (str): id for the reaction

Returns: list of tuples of (curve species, curve role name, and curve

width) for each curve in the reaction

setReactionCurveWidth(reaction_id, curve_width, role_name=None, species=None)¶

Sets the line width of the curve for all curves in the reaction. If the role or species args are set, then the color is set only for curves in a reaction which have that role or are connected to that species.

Args:
reaction_id (str): id of the reaction to change the width of one

reaction, or ‘all’ to change the width of all the reactions

curve_width (int): numeric value representing the line width role_name (optional, str): role of the curve in the reaction,

for example, “product”

species (optional, str): species to which the curve is connected,

for example, “A” or “Node0”

Returns: None

getArrowheadStyle(role)¶

Returns the arrowhead style for the given role.

Args:

role (int): which role

Returns: int

setArrowheadStyle(role, style)¶

Set the arrowhead style for the given role.

Args:

role (int): which role style (int): which style

Returns: None

getArrowheadNumVerts(style)¶

Returns the number of vertices in the arrowhead of the given style.

Args:

style (int): which arrowhead style

Returns:int

getArrowheadVert(style, vertex_number)¶

Returns a point for the given vertex_number, given an arrowhead style.

Args:

style (int): which arrowhead style vertex_number (int): specify the vertex in the arrowhead

Returns: point with fields x and y

getArrowheadNumStyles()¶

Returns the number of arrowhead styles available.

Args: None

Returns: int

drawNetwork(save_file_name=None, show=True, dpi=72, width_shift=0.25, height_shift=0.25, scaling_factor=1)¶

Draws the network to screen. The figure can be saved.

Args:

save_file_name (optional, str): save figure to this file show (optional, bool): if True, display the network on screen dpi (optional, int): desired dots-per-inch for the figure width_shift (optional, float): size in inches of the left and right

borders

height_shift (optional, float): size in inches of the bottom and

top borders

scaling_factor (option, float): decrease or increase the size of

the figure using this factor; example, 0.5 results in reducing the figure size by one-half

Returns: matplotlib.figure.Figure

setArrowheadScale(role, arrowhead_scale)¶

Set a value for matplotlib’s mutation_scale to change the size of the arrowhead for a given role. The default value is 10. Bigger values result in bigger arrowheads.

Args:

arrowhead_scale(int): passed on to matplotlib role(int): role of the reaction

Returns: None

getArrowheadScale(role)¶

Returns the arrowhead scale for the given role. Bigger values result in bigger arrowheads.

Args: role(int)

Returns: int

getNumberOfRoles()¶

Args: None

Returns: int

getReactionBezierPoints(reaction_id)¶

Returns a list of Bezier points (start, end, control1, control2) for each curve in the reaction.

Args:

reaction_id(str): id for the reaction

Returns: list, of BezierPoints named tuple of tuples
